intent_atoms.description: Provide operators with clear storage locations and mount expectations for large fixture downloads on macOS and Linux CI agents.
Spell out required disk quotas and mount paths for macOS runners (~40 GB) and Linux CI caches (~15 GB) with headroom recommendations.

Provide directory layout diagrams tying together Documentation/FixtureCatalog/manifest.json, mirrored licenses, and Distribution/Fixtures/<category>/ staging folders so operators know where downloads land.
Include setup steps for mounting or syncing caches on both platforms, referencing the existing generate_fixtures.py invocation patterns to keep tooling consistent.
The fixture storage guidance must align with current fixture tooling conventions under Distribution/Fixtures/ and accompanying license texts.

Confirm whether macOS runners expose writable volumes like /Volumes/Fixtures or use workspace-relative directories, describing fallback strategies such as symlinks if elevated permissions are unavailable.
Capture expectations for periodic cache refreshes, including checksum validation via the manifest helper to avoid stale or corrupted assets during release readiness rehearsals.
Coordinate fixture storage guidance with the release readiness runbook so it dovetails with notarization and benchmark preflight checklists tracked for macOS distribution sign-off.

functional_units.name: Disk Quota Specification
functional_units.description: Defines required disk space and headroom for macOS runners (~40 GB) and Linux CI caches (~15 GB).

functional_units.name: Mount Path Definition
functional_units.description: Specifies the exact mount points or workspace-relative directories for fixture storage on macOS and Linux, including fallback strategies such as symlinks.

functional_units.name: Directory Layout Diagram
functional_units.description: Provides a visual layout tying together manifest.json, mirrored license texts, and Distribution/Fixtures/<category>/ staging folders to show where downloads are stored.

functional_units.name: Setup Steps for Mounting/Synchronizing Caches
functional_units.description: Outlines commands or scripts to mount or sync fixture caches on both platforms, referencing generate_fixtures.py usage.

functional_units.name: Periodic Cache Refresh Policy
functional_units.description: Describes how often caches should be refreshed and includes checksum validation via the manifest helper to prevent stale or corrupted assets.

functional_units.name: Integration with Release Readiness Runbook
functional_units.description: Aligns fixture storage guidance with notarization, benchmark preflight checks, and other release readiness processes.
